Authors: McNeely, Clea; Barber, Brian K.; Spellings, Carolyn; Belli, Robert; Giacaman, Rita; Arafat, Cairo; Daher, Mahmoud; El Sarraj, Eyad; Abu Mallouh, Mohammed
Article Title: Political Imprisonment and Adult Functioning: A Life Event History Analysis of Palestinians
Abstract: Political imprisonment is a traumatic event, often accompanied by torture and deprivation. This study explores the association of political imprisonment between 1987 and 2011 with political, economic, community, psychological, physical, and family functioning in a population-based sample of Palestinian men ages 32-43 years (N = 884) derived from a dataset collected in 2011. Twenty-six percent (n = 233) had been politically imprisoned. Men imprisoned between 1987 and 2005 reported functioning as well as never-imprisoned men in most domains, suggesting that men imprisoned as youth have moved forward with their lives in ways similar to their nonimprisoned counterparts. In an exception to this pattern, men imprisoned during the Oslo Accords period (1994-1999) reported higher levels of trauma-related stress (B = 0.24, p = .027) compared to never-imprisoned men. Men imprisoned since 2006 reported lower functioning in multiple domains: human insecurity (B = 0.33, p = .023), freedom of public expression (B = -0.48, p = .017), perceived government stability (B = -0.38, p = .009), feeling broken or destroyed (B = 0.59, p = .001), physical limitations (B = 0.55, p = .002), and community belonging (B = -0.33, p = .048). Findings pointed to the value of examining the effects of imprisonment on functioning in multiple domains.Resumen El encarcelamiento politico es un evento traumatico, frecuentemente acompanado por tortura y privacion. Este estudio explora la asociacion del encarcelamiento politico entre 1987 y 2011 con el funcionamiento politico, economico, comunitario, psicologico, fisico y familiar, en una muestra basada en una poblacion de hombres palestinos de entre 32 y 43 anos (N = 884) derivados de un conjunto de datos recolectados en el 2011. En total un 26% habia sido prisionero politico. Los hombres prisioneros entre 1987 y 2005 reportaron estar funcionando tan bien como los hombres que nunca estuvieron en prision en la mayoria de los dominios, sugiriendo que los hombres prisioneros en su juventud habian seguido adelante con sus vidas en caminos similares que sus homologos no prisioneros. Como una excepcion a este patron, los hombres prisioneros durante el Periodo de Acuerdos de Oslo (1994-1999) reportaron altos niveles de estres relacionados a trauma (B = 0.24, p = .027) comparados con los hombres que nunca fueron prisioneros. Los hombres encarcelados desde el 2006 reportaron un menor funcionamiento en multiples dominios: Inseguridad humana (B = 0.33, p = .009), libertad de expresion publica (B = -0.48, p = .017) estabilidad gubernamental percibida (B = -0.38, p = .009), sentirse destrozado o destruido (B = 0.59, p = .001), limitaciones fisicas (B = 0.55, p = .002) y pertenencia a la comunidad (B = -0.33, p = .048). Los resultados destacaron la utilidad de examinar los efectos del encarcelamiento en el funcionamiento en multiples dominios.Traditional and Simplified Chinese Abstracts by AsianSTSS ?? : ??????????????????????? ??: ????????????????????????????2011???????,????32?43??????????????(N = 884),??1987??2011????????????????????????????????????26%???????????????,1987??2005??????????????????????,????????????????????????????????????????(1994 - 1999)?????,??????????,???????????????(B = 0.24, p = .027)?2006??????????????????????????(B = 0.33, p = .023)????????(B = -0.48, p = .017)?????????(B = -0.38, p = .009)?????????(B = 0.59, p = .001)?????(B = 0.55, p = .002)???????(B = -0.33, p = .048)???????????????????????? ?? : ??????????????????????? ??: ???????????????????????????2011???????,????32?43??????????????(N = 884),??1987??2011??????????????????????????????????26%???????????????,1987??2005??????????????????????,????????????????????????????????????????(1994 - 1999)?????,??????????,???????????????(B = 0.24, p = .027)?2006??????????????????????????(B = 0.33, p = .023)????????(B = -0.48, p = .017)?????????(B = -0.38, p = .009)?????????(B = 0.59, p = .001)?????(B = 0.55, p = .002)???????(B = -0.33, p = .048)????????????????????????
